review.itemreviewed: Cottonwood Low B-DRY Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The fit/sizing was good. The toebox seemed a little tight at first but being leather it loosened up quickly.  The lacing was too frustrating. Nylon laces do NOT pull through leather slits without an awful lot of effort, so instep fit was hard to get. I wear custom orthotics, so the first thing I have to do is get rid of the insole orthotics provided and use a flat cushuioned insole.  I liked the features and the look, but the ultimate fit was just not there.
review.name: Wanted these to work!

review.itemreviewed: Cottonwood Low B-DRY Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Pros: Great looking shoe. Arch support is good. Toe box sees to have plenty of room but could be wider for me, maybe great for some. For reference I usually get women's 8 D in Brooks Glycerin running shoes. 
Cons: STIFF. Stiff. Stiff. The shoelaces and lacing holes are terrible. Feel clunky.
I ultimately decided to return.
review.name: Stiff. Shoestrings are terrible.

name: Cottonwood Low B-DRY Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Bought a little while ago, glad I got the 106, fits just right in my storage unit lol
review.name: Good kayak so far

review.reviewBody: Old Town makes Excellent kayaks ! However they are extremely expensive !
Love it. Comfortable and just what I was looking for
review.name: Loon 106

review.reviewBody: Stands straight up in my storage unit. My first kayak but I crossed Amistad in it. I'm not the one to ask but it seems strong and durable. I am happy with my purchase can't wait for spring too use it more in south Texas.
review.name: My first kayak

review.reviewBody: The Kayaks are absolutely incredible. But both came with major deep scratches and one came with a deep gash in the side of the hull. When they came off the truck they were only wrapped in plastic. No protection whatsoever around the hulls. Also, we did not get the Kayak locking lids that go on the back of the Loons. We got the lid that is held down by ropes. I am disappointed for sure about this because we spent almost 3K on everything and I would expect to get something a with a little more damage control effort. Makes me weary of buying from here again. Customer service is helping me through the situation now and they're easy to talk to about it. But it still can't change the fact the above has already happened after waiting two weeks for these boats. :(
review.name: Disapointed

review.reviewBody:
I’d been in need of a kayak upgrade for nearly two years and was tethering between 2 models.  I was fortunate to locate this one in photic right around the corner, which sealed my decision between the two models and at this point I’m chalking it up to “fate”.  

I live in a beach town on the Ling Island Sound and wanted something that could perform on the nearby river, in the flat salt marshes and of course that I could cart down the street and launch in the Sound on days that aren’t snotty.  I also wanted something light enough that I can hoist it the back of my Jeep Gladiator without help.  This ticked all of those boxes.  

Since buying it I have taken it on all sorts of water types and she performs like champ! Tracking is a dream and I love the speed! I have a standard run of the mill paddle too.  I can only imagine what improvements I will experience when I upgrade my paddle next spring.  

If you’re tossing between this model and another - don’t.  Get this one.  Period.  The seat is Uber comfortable.  It’s easy to launch, even when conditions aren’t great and is easy to clean and care for.
review.name: Best thing I did for myself this year was buy this

review.reviewBody: These are hard to find right now, so when I found one nearby that was in stock I pounced on it…. It was a replacement for an older Dirigo that I had enjoyed for many years.  I fell in love with the Loon model during a vacation in Maine.  The craft is very steady, and tracks straight.  The seat is super comfy (much better that the Dirigo’s seat), and I love the convenience of the removable console.  I will never own anything but an Old Town, due to their history, their supreme build quality, and the beauty of their boats.  This is American craftsmanship at its finest.  I have used it so far in some Virginia lakes and slow moving rivers, and can’t wait to explore some North Carolina black water next spring.  P.S. When my husband saw mine he got the same one in black cherry!
review.name: Best Kayak out there!

review.reviewBody: I've been kayaking for a year, so I do not consider myself an expert, but I am a research freak when it comes to spending my hard earned money on something new.  I've done alot of research on kayaks and have used at least 4 different brands so when it came time to purchase a new one, there was only one decision hard for me.  What color?  Old Town, in my opinion, is the best for quality and best bang for your buck. The seats in the Loon are the most comfortable on the market. I love this boat above all the others I've been in.  If I had one thing I would like changed, is move the adjustable foot rest 4" forward.  (This would be a general rule for all the brands). I'm 6'-5" and when it comes to kayaks, I feel the tall people are never considered.  The first thing I had to do with my new kayak was move the foot rest and epoxy the original holes.  This would still work for the shorter users as there is a large range of adjustments, but that 4" makes a world of difference for me. You will not be disappointed in your purchase no matter what Old Town product you decide on.
review.name: Great Quality Kayak

review.reviewBody: The following is, I believe, a fairly detailed review of the new Old Town Loon 106. Hopefully it will answer some questions for those who have them. So.....I decided to spoil myself with a new boat. I knew I wanted a boat in the 10 foot range, which is what I’ve mostly been paddling for the last several years. For comparison, I’ve been paddling a 10 foot boat, which is an excellent boat in the mid-price range. It is pretty comfortable and tracks pretty well in a variety of conditions, and Is also pretty smooth to paddle. However, as I’m getting older and my back occasionally complains with longer paddles (over 2 hours), I was looking for an upgrade. My priorities included a very comfortable seat and boat, that tracked well and was quiet in the water, that with any luck would carry me to the end of my paddling days, hopefully many moons from now. After doing some research and testing a few models at a local paddle shop, I decided to go with the Old Town Loon 106. I had paddled the old style Loon in Maine in large, open ponds in Baxter State Park quite a few times during multiple trips there over the past ten plus years, and enjoyed it a great deal. The new Loon is a beauty. It had the most comfortable seat of those I tried (far more comfortable in some cases), and was nice to paddle (as well as you can tell in a small pond for trying out boats). Since my new Loon came in over a month ago, I’ve been out in it close to 20 hours in multiple locations in lakes and on creeks, from slow, calm water, to water with some chop, to water with 2 to 3 foot waves. It’s handled it all like a pro. The seat is incredibly comfortable and has lots of adjustments. Once you find a sweet spot for your back as I did, I don’t know that you’ll need to tweak it very often. I certainly haven’t so far. But the point is, if you’d like to, you can, and in a variety of ways, all while sitting in the seat. The boat is also very comfortable to be in in general. Foot braces are larger than my older boat, which feel great under foot. There is plenty of room for my long legs (I’m 6 feet tall) in a variety of leg positions. The boat cuts through the water very smoothly and quietly. It also tracks very well, better than any other boat in its size range that I’ve tried. I do notice the weight difference at 53 pounds, as my older boat is 42 pounds. It’s still easy enough for me to get up on the car rack myself. If you aren’t sure if it will be too heavy for you to do this, I would definitely recommend lifting it (or a boat within a pound of it either way) as if you were putting it up on your car, which I did after I demo’d it. At some point, as age keeps chasing me, I’ll have to alter how I get it on the rack, but that would be the same for a lighter boat, albeit a few years later perhaps. The boat came with a paddle clip, which I enjoy having more than I would have thought I would. The back hatch seals very well. It also come with a crazy cool console, with a dry storage space, water bottle holders, bike water bottle holder under the console, and even a phone charging cord built into it. It is easily removable, but I just keep it on as it helps shade more of my legs and is not even close to being in my way. Being sort of old school, I still carry my Nalgene bottle by my hip, and throw a small backpack behind the seat or in the hatch with my other items. That said, my favorite console feature thus far is the small bungee-type cord that is right at the front of the console. It holds my cell phone securely in place and is in easy reach for anything deemed worthy of a photo, and I slide one of the arms of my sunglasses behind it to keep them handy. Everything about this boat seems to scream, “Yo! Check me out!” in terms of its high quality strength and looks. I love it, and couldn’t recommend it more, and I’m certainly glad that I didn’t ignore the call of the Loon.  Just make sure you can get it on/in your car :)
review.name: The call of the Loon is hard to ignore.

review.reviewBody: My wife and I each purchased one and love them!  We recommend them to anyone who wants to enjoy a day on the river.
review.name: Love this kayak

name: Loon 106 Recreational Kayak

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Exactly what we’ve been looking for- a carry on that can flex for our travel needs. Wheel it in airports and on our backs when we are tackling stairs and variable terrain.
review.name: Exactly what we’ve been looking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very happy with this pack. The extra pocket in the front is great for adding last minute items
review.name: Very happy with this pack.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this rolling backpack to carry my plein air painting supplies.  Can lift it through rocky terrain & will use for airline travel as well.  Love it!
review.name: Great pack!

review.reviewBody: I appreciate the functionality of this travel bag, the fact that you can use it as a backpack or rolling bag is fantastic. The material is sturdy and of great quality. Perfect as a carry-on for air travel!
review.name: Great Functional Travel Bag

review.reviewBody: I purchased this bag prior to a trip to Kenya, a trip that required a comfortable bag that could be converted into a backpack. My group was heading into the arid lands of Northern Kenya and the puddle jumper we took had weight limits. Needless to say, I needed a bag that could be used in the airports and also survive a week in a rural area with zero available services. This bag PERFORMED. It rolled effortlessly throughout the 35+ hours of travel. I loved its hybrid features which allowed me to easily convert it to a backpack when we arrived in our destination. Regardless of how much gear (clothes, headlamp, IFAK, emergency kit, toiletries, etc.,) the bag remained light and was comfortable to carry. I had also the accompanying day bag plus which attached perfectly to this bag. I was legitimately blown away by how comfortable it was to carry. The handle does protrude into the cargo space a bit but it never bothered or disrupted my needs. Packing for disaster response trips requires one to be savvy (and to be honest, you're traveling internationally, you don't need to go crazy on what items to bring. Trust me, you don't need that item). This Osprey bag is my preferred bag to travel, for work or for personal needs. And yes, she fits perfectly in overhead cabin space. I've taken this bag in several international trips, some for fun and others for my line of work and each time this bag ensured I had everything I could need. Highly recommend. @Osprey - please continue to keep this in your lineup.
review.name: Perfect for Humanitarian Response

review.reviewBody: Very sizeable and comfortable. I was looking for something a little bigger than my 55 that also had wheels as it can be tiring carrying around a heavy bag/backpack. Unfortunately this bag is too big to be used as carryon luggage (as was my reason for purchasing). It also has a very visible V in the middle for the tube that hinders your ability to pack as much as you would like.
review.name: Very nice bag but too big for carryon

name: Fairview Wheeled 36L Travel Pack

review.itemreviewed: First Light Stretch Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: color (fig) is gorgeous. the coat is lightweight, and medium warmth, just what i was looking for. I ordered medium, ideal for layering underneath. 5'6"athletic build, usually sleeves are too short for me, this size is perfect (sleeve still covers arm even when stretching it overhead).
review.name: love everything about this jacket

review.itemreviewed: First Light Stretch Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I ordered this jacket as fall hit us here in coastal Alaska because I was looking for a synthetic jacket warm enough for winter temps that would bring me joy to look at. This is the one! The XS fit is great for a 5’1 115lb person. The arms are nice and long, so no feeling of them riding up. In terms of warmth, this is a great four seasons jacket for AK and in the depth of winter I’ll layer it with plenty of wool layers underneath and a shell on top. The color is true to the photo, bright and fun. Great for alpine adventure.
review.name: Slice of sunshine for the Alaskan winter

name: First Light Stretch Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have a Giant FastRoad Carbon with the stock grips that I have been riding for the past 6 years. I have always noticed numbness in my hands after riding for a short period of time, I would just shake my hands out to get temporary relief during the ride. I finally decided to search for new grips and came upon Ergon grips. Having larger hands, I opted for the GP3. They arrived in a few days and swapping out grips was a breeze. It has been a night and day difference, I can ride for a much longer period of time bed without any hint of numbness. I wish I would have purchased these from the get go!
review.name: Why did I wait so long!

name: GP4 Grips

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My son needed a new hoodie and prefers plain with no graphics. This was perfect. He is 6'0" and 155 lbs - the medium was a perfect fit and was a good fit for his long lean frame and long arms. We have grey, light olive and bought a 3rd one (blue) to put under the Xmas tree. They are worn every week, alternately and wash well with minimal or no fading. Only complaint is that the fabric pills a bit because there is some synthetic in the fabric (likely to prevent shrinkage). Make more Northface!

review.reviewBody: This is a very comfortable and good looking helmet. I went from another brand that would slip around. This stays in the same position and doesn’t create any pressure points. Worth the money.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: This is my second Protone Icon.  The first lasted me for seven years until I realized I was probably pushing my luck with an older helmet.  I think they have even improved the ventilation but the fit and comfort is the same as my last model.   Helmets are an individual preference but this works very well for my needs in a hot climate.
review.name: Second Time Around

review.reviewBody: Finally made the leap to a Kask helmet, and I'm so glad that I did.  This helmet fits my head perfectly and is secure without being tight or having pressure points.  It has great adjustability, the straps lay nicely around the ears, and the leatherette chin strap with offset clip is comfortable.  Nice ventilation on hot summer rides and now using on winter rides with a thin cap without issue.  Great looking helmet, I would highly recommend.
review.name: Great Helmet

review.reviewBody: I’m not sure why Backcountry is asking me to review this item. It did not fit well and was very uncomfortable, so I immediately returned it. I have no actual review of the helmet. I will be seeking other means of protecting my noggin whilst riding camelback across Arabia.
review.name: Returned immediately

review.reviewBody: POC helmets don't fit my head, Sweet Protection helmets don't vent as much as I'd like... Which led me to Kask. Wide adjustability range -- both circumference and vertical alignment at the nape of the neck. Soft, supple faux leather neck strap lining is a nice detail.
review.name: Excellent fit, highly adjustable

review.reviewBody: Helmet fits great.  I have 2 Protones.  Your use of the government (USPS) to ship products meant I did not get the helmet for a critical race so I returned it.
review.name: Great helmet but…

review.reviewBody: I love this helmet during hot summer rides. I am not overheating, and it adjusts to my head perfectly.
review.name: Kask Protone Icon Helmet

review.reviewBody:
I wear a small helmet.   I use a mask, just not this model. I wanted to upgrade.  The helmet fit fine on my head but the straps were HUGE on my face.  Almost came to the side of my mouth.  It appears you are using a one size fits all for your straps??

I had to send it back.  Again, this is not an issue on the task I bought 2 years ago and currently use.
review.name: Straps are way to big

review.reviewBody: I’ve put off dropping the change for a Protone helmet for a while. I was hesitant about the sizing, but ordered a Medium based upon the sizing charts. I am so glad that it did - it fit perfectly. It’s got a great fit and doesn’t look like a mushroom. It is comfortable and has great ventilation. I like it so much that I’m already considering adding another to my collection .
review.name: Amazing Helmet

review.reviewBody: My noggin definitely feels safe in the Protone, but it does run a little smaller than before. My biggest beef is that they changed the padding on the inside to some kind of really scratchy material, which make my skin itch and gives me a rash on my forehead. Sigh.
review.name: Fits well but …

name: Protone Icon Helmet

review.reviewBody: I like how they're thicker than the 150 liners. Does a much better job at keeping my hands warm, even when wet and outside of my main gloves. They also don't seem to retain any odors, even when your hands are sweating from a hard day on the slopes. Only complaint is durability, be careful letting them near your ski edges as they may tear. But they're otherwise great and I personally keep a few sets around to swap between as the wear out.
review.name: Warm and soft

review.reviewBody:
I bought this less than a month ago from a local retailer. The only thing I've done with these so far is walk to/from my car at home and work each day. Within the first three days, the rubber/plastic grip on the fingers was peeling off. By week twoish, I noticed the right middle finger was starting to fray--now, roughly a week later, there's a full hole in the finger.

It could just be a poor one-off, since it's only one finger that has torn so far and even the stitching on my left glove looks noticeably better than my right glove (which has the torn finger).

I've never purchased from Outdoor Research before, and I figured I'd give them a shot. The gloves are comfortable, and they kept my hands decently warm down to around 0F on their own, and kept my hands warm down to -26F when used as liners inside some glove shells. But the durability is almost completely non-existent.
review.name: Very warm and comfortable, zero durability

review.reviewBody: I’ve used them on hikes and runs a few times this fall. Absolutely adore them so far

I bought these as to use as liners inside down mittens on a recent photography trip to Norway. Plan was to take off the mittens when I needed to adjust the camera touch screen, so I was only looking for some wind and cold protection. Well these do give minimal protection but they did not work with my camera touch screen at all. I ended up removing them repeatedly and having miserably cold fingers much of the trip. About the only thing they were good for was pushing the shutter button. No idea if they work on larger screens but if you're a photographer don't waste your time or money.
review.name: Not worth the money

name: Alpine Onset Merino 240 Sensor Liner

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this on Saturday. Walked a block in it. It rubbed my right ankle so hard that I have bleeding. also rubbed my left little toe raw. I need to return and exchange these now. Willing to do online. The triangle on the right ankle rubbed constantly. The strap across the left toe did also. Have not been able to submit my claim to return/exchange online.
review.name: Terrible! Do NOT buy!

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: The triangular plastic connectors rub on my ankles. Within minutes of wearing them the skin below my ankles was worn raw and was bleeding. Very disappointing.
review.name: Want your ankles to bleed? Then get this sandal.

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable but for walking in the city with cobble stone and brick sidewalks the sole could be more rigid.
review.name: Summer comfort in the city

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are very comfortable. Easy to adjust and were perfect size wise.
review.name: Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: Extremely disappointed; can't count how many times I have recommended Merrell. Wanted something approaching classic sandals, not gussied-up crocs. Bery, very uncomfortable. Straps have velcro sewn right to the edge so that it digs into my skin at multiple point. Have worn them four times now, thinking I'd grow into them.  After examining them, I realize why that would be a futile quest.  Will attempt to return.
review.name: Poor, unwearable design

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve been wearing these sandals every day for the last couple of weeks and they are the most comfortable sandals I own. They are completely adjustable to hug my feet to the point that they feel like they are part of my feet.
review.name: Totally comfortable.

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: Like the look, reminds of the Teva sandals. But the straps are too loose for me. Better for a fatter foot I guess.
review.name: Hiking sandal

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really like the traction that these souls have they don’t slip at all. The only Gripe i have is the little triangle on the right foot rubs my foot a little raw. I’m not sure if it’s the strap or the plastic but nonetheless it’s not comfortable. Without socks if you’re wearing socks they’re great but I’m Barefeet. It’s a little tough to take. I would recommend buying these. March 21st, I was standing on a hillside with sandals that had absolutely no tread, and there were needles long, pine dried needles on the ground, and I thought to myself I need to be careful within seconds I was on the ground and my shoulder sustained severe damage, tore three tendons off of the top of the shoulder required surgery. These sandals that I purchased here are the replacement to the ones that I was wearing when I was injured. I threw the dockers in the garbage, and I’ve been wearing these ever scents they’re comfortable you don’t feel the rocks underneath your feet at all and they have good gripping ability.
review.name: Souls that have a grip and no slip

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: Have an older pair and a different design, love them.  Straps on these are 3/8", (10mm) narrower than the straps on my old pair.  They cut into my ankle.  Can't wear them.  Merrell made good on the return.
review.name: Redesigned

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought this pair of sandals last week, expecting them to be similar to the Speed Fusion Strap (J004989) that I purchased last year.  The Speed Fusion Strap sandals were AWESOME, but it appears that they have been discontinued.  I lived the entire summer last year in the Speed Fusion Strap.

The new Speed Fusion Web Sport, does not come close to the old version.  First time that I wore them for a short 1/2 mile walk, I developed blisters on the outside of both ankles and one little toe, where the hard plastic triangles bring the straps together.  Will probably continue to try  wearing them, but will need to put some Band-Aids on before-hand in order to minimize any abrasions.

I have been extremely happy with all of my previous Merrell purchases.  This is the first to be a little disappointing
review.name: Not as comfortable as the old Speed Fusion Strap

name: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Men's

review.reviewBody: I wasn't too sure about these when I ordered them but they've now become my go-to shorts for paddleboarding and hiking. Super lightweight, dry quick, and very comfy. They weigh next to nothing so great addition to backpacking gear too.

review.reviewBody: I got these with the intention to mountain bike in them and I love them. I like them over my short liners so it gives a 2 tiered look, a little refreshing aesthetic when riding single track instead of the longer shorts that are usually on the trail.
review.name: Light as a feather

review.reviewBody:
Very psyched on these shorts. Bought them initially as a pure running short, and have found myself wearing them for a myriad of different activities - biking, climbing, trail running, scrambling/ridge running. 

The weight is amazing - super light, airy, breathable, but are substantial enough to provide some coverage. The fit is solid - I'm a 32 waist and the M is perfect. The legs are loose and extremely comfortable and a contemporary fit - i.e. not tight fitting and uncomfortable. 

The little pocket in the back is great to stash my car keys in so they aren't rattling around in the normal pocket.

And the purple color is richhhh.

description: Buy the Garmin Edge Explore 2 GPS online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Edge Explore 2 GPS
hasVariant.description: Buy the Garmin Edge Explore 2 GPS online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I had very few problems with the GPS unit. I enjoyed the simple design and ability to pick up a signal in rural places. Loves the warnings and climbing features, and how it integrates into your phone and other Garmin devices. I have some general problems with Garmin, such as connection issues between the app and this device. I had more issues connecting to this GPS than my watch that I have had for many years.

Unfortunately, I inadvertently volunteered to strength test this Garmin and dropped it onto a hard surface. The device still works but the screen is completely broken, leaving no visible features to interact with. No warranty for this type of damage, despite it being relatively new, is frustrating to say the least, and something I try to avoid when purchasing outdoor equipment. Won't be buying another one.
review.name: Great GPS for the price, but fragile

name: Edge Explore 2 GPS

description: Buy the Altra Via Olympus Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Via Olympus Running Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Altra Via Olympus Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Finally a blister free running shoe. I recently bought a pair of lone peaks for hiking and fell in love. So when I decided to start walking again I looked into Altras. I loved them. Then I decided to start running. These via olympus are absolutely perfect for me. So happy. Not thrilled with the colors but at my age I am more interested in fit than looks. One other small note, the pair I received had a small smudge on the fabric. I'm sure I could have swapped them, but shoes get dirty anyway and so it wasn't worth the effort. That being said, I will buy another pair when these wear out.
review.name: I will purchase again, finally a zero blister shoe

review.reviewBody: They have no cushion and they are supposed to be the most cushioned shoe. I have the 2 version and its much more cushioned.
review.name: Do not buy, waste of money

review.reviewBody: I've always had trouble with my 2nd toe bending even thought I buy size 9 1/2 as most shoes aren't wide enough to help with wide feet. I am very happy with the purchase. Only thing is it has a bit of a height.
review.name: I would recommend this product to a friend

review.reviewBody: I wore these to train for a marathon. After running about 550 miles in them, I didn't even realize I needed new shoes! They kept their cushion so well that I was in denial that I needed a new pair. These are great if you have wider feet as well.
review.name: 500+ miles

review.reviewBody: I thought Hoka was the best fit for me... Then I tried these on by chance. Wow! My number 1!! My absolute fav!
review.name: Beats Homa!

review.reviewBody: Disappointing Experience with Running Shoes I recently purchased the running shoes, hoping they would be a reliable addition to my running gear. Unfortunately, my experience has been far from satisfactory. After running just 5 miles, I developed huge blisters on my feet. The shoes felt comfortable initially, but it became clear that they lack the necessary support and cushioning for longer runs. The material seems to cause excessive friction, which led to the painful blisters. While the design and aesthetics of the shoes are appealing, the performance and comfort are severely lacking. I would not recommend these shoes for anyone looking to run longer distances. It's disappointing to invest in a product that doesn't meet basic comfort standards.
review.name: Don't buy this

review.reviewBody: I love this Altra shoe. I bought the same style again so I could use one to work in my yard. I'm 73 yrs and have terrible feet problems and I have finally found shoes that I can wear all day. I would love other colors.
review.name: I love this shoe!!

review.reviewBody: Middle toes go numb because it's too tight across base of toes. Along with a wide toebox, there also needs to be extra height as well.
review.name: Needs Improvement

review.reviewBody: The heel cup pushes in prior to the arch. Definitely not for my whole foot wideness. Finished some shorter runs without issues. Ran a 10K and ended up with numbness in forefoot and a blister on my heel near my arch.
review.name: Tried and not for me

review.reviewBody: I can't describe what's is wrong with the shoe. I run two miles and my toes so numb. Not too big or small. Maybe the outer sole? These shoes hurt. Wear my escalates and it's fine. So sad. Wasted money.
review.name: So very bad

name: Via Olympus Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I've worn these caps for almost 15 years under my hard hat while working in the gas fields at very high altitudes during brutal winters and sub zero temperatures.  I love them and if I'm just going for a walk or riding my bike during cool months, it's just perfect for me as well. . I sweat profusely but the hat never seems to get wet or it'll dry in minutes in a warm car for example.  Thank you OR!
review.name: Blocks wind, warm, long lasting.  Breathes.

review.reviewBody: This is probably the best hat I have ever worn. Regardless of the temperature or the conditions, it has kept me warm and dry. I have used it for working in the yard, hiking , running and skiing. It doesn't matter whether it's raining or snowing or anything else the weather can throw at me, it keeps me comfortable without ever overheating. Great job OR!
review.name: Best Hat Ever

description: Buy the Smith Prospect Jr Mips Helmet - Kids' online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Prospect Jr Mips Helmet - Kids'
hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Prospect Jr Mips Helmet - Kids' online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Prospect Jr Mips Helmet - Kids'
hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Prospect Jr Mips Helmet - Kids' online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit with the googles. Especially over glasses.
review.name: Perfect fit with the googles.

review.reviewBody:
This is a great helmet for fit and protection. It is warm, fits well on my 5 year old, grows with the child, fantastic. My family is all smith for all sports, but I really wouldn't buy this again. 

It has one major flaw. The goggle clip on the back is useless. We have lost two pairs of goggles, as it doesn't keep the goggles secure and they slip out the bottom. This is especially the case with children, who are just getting used to putting goggles on their helmet and often put them too far up or too far back and they slip off. If that's the case, the clip won't retain them.
review.name: Great helmet - but you're bound to lose goggles

review.reviewBody: Tout semble assez bien en général, belle couleur et style. Le fit ne semble pas parfait pour ma fille de 6 ans, je ne suis pas certain que le size soit adéquat. Par contre la ventilation semble très bien.
review.name: Semble bien en général

review.reviewBody: It's amazing how much room for growth this liner and helmet has! We have a 1 year old and have been struggling to find a helmet, but this one is perfect! And she'll be able to grow into it for many years.
review.name: Best kid/baby helmet on the market!

review.reviewBody: Great helmet but it did not fit my son so sadly had to be exchanged for another model. Smith makes wonderful helmets. My son was spared from injury due to wearing one on a recent ski trip. So we won’t hesitate to buy theirs again!
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: Great construction and will fit for years with the ability to remove liner. Very pleased with quality.
review.name: Great Buy

review.reviewBody: The adjustment buckles on both side straps really need to be locking buckles to keep the helmet level for both our kids.
review.name: The adjustment buckles on both

review.reviewBody:
It’s small than her sisters Zoom from 2 years ago. 
Would have liked it just a bit larger so she might get next season out of it too. 
She likes the ventilation
review.name: It’s small than her sisters

review.reviewBody: My 5 year 10 month old son loves his helmet. The fit is great. He especially loves the red and black color, which matches his reds tee skis. He likes the ventilation as well.
review.name: My 5 year 10 month

review.reviewBody: The helmet works perfectly for my growing girl. The removable liner was perfect when she outgrew the original size and with it removed, it fits just as well. The ventilation works perfectly keeping my daughter at the right temperature this way she isn’t too cold at the top and doesn’t overheat at the bottom. A true plus is that she also likes the look of it. A superb helmet for any kid!
review.name: A superb helmet for any growing kid.

name: Prospect Jr Mips Helmet - Kids'

review.reviewBody: I like them and might buy black or light brown ones if available. They are tighter than my other Keen shoes in width and length, as the website said. A softer, fabric version would be interesting.
review.name: I like them and might

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have a wide forefoot and narrow heel. My latest pair of Targhee III is my third pair. The first two pair were cut wider in the toe box, and a better fit right out of the box. This latest version is cut closer to a traditional medium width, being too narrow in the forefoot. My toes feel a bit compressed, particularly with a hiking sock. Many American shoe brands seem to want to economize on materials by offering only medium width shoes, or doing like this latest version, using the cut to try to work for both medium and wide feet. It is a fool’s errand. Fit is priority 1 for me. Although I’m disappointed with this more narrow cut, I’m going to have the toe box stretched in hopes I can get a better fit. Regarding other features, I love the slip-on construction. The close cut and fit around the ankle prevent the shoe from slipping off when traversing rough terrain.
review.name: Bought a Wide size, but a bit narrow in the forefoot

review.reviewBody: I plan to buy a second pair because these are so great for my size 16 extra wide. Tired of having my feet squished and uncomfortable. These feel great for all day wear. The tread is perfect for my lifestyle always hiking always outside. Look great with jeans.
review.name: Best fit I've had in a long time

review.reviewBody: I ordered these one half size larger and they are perfect. They're comfortable from the start and very sure-footed. Very happy with the purchase!
review.name: Great fit and comfortable to walk in

review.reviewBody: Comfortable just put soars on top of my feet above ankles. Not the ones I wanted but you have been out of mine for awhile. 2 pair in 3 years the ones I like and them never a problem.
review.name: Comfortable just put soars on

review.reviewBody: I could not give this slip-on 5 stars because it does not slip-on. A shoe horn is required to enter the shoe, but once your foot is inside the fit is near perfect.
review.name: Men's Targhee III Wide Slip-On does not slip-on.

review.reviewBody: These are my third pair; I work in them so they get abused. That being said they offer great stability and comfort. I would highly recommend these for any occasion. Just because they look nice doesn't mean you can't wear them in the dirt works field! Very happy with Keens consistent quality.
review.name: Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: The opening to the shoe is too small. Could barely get foot in. Only tried one foot and the tightness around my ankle was unbearable so I can’t respond to product fit. Had to return.
review.name: Small opening

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's not my first Keen shoe. They're the only shoes and boots I've bought for many years. These replaced a similar shoe that I've had for over 10 years and are now my yard work shoes. I have wide feet (3/4E) and the Keen wides in both shoe and boots fit great.
review.name: Another keeper

review.reviewBody:
The shoes are working great so far. They don't seem very wide but are comfortable.
You guys are the best company to deal with and have a great warranty.
review.name: Great shoes

name: Targhee III Slip-On Wide - Men's

review.reviewBody: I read reviews of these shoes on the Path Less Pedaled and Radavist websites and decided to give them a try. I normally wear size 10 in Five Ten shoes; these are size 45, which Giro says equates to size 10.5, but I find they fit like the Five Tens. The shoes are light, and the Boa lacing system makes for quick on and off. I ride flat pedals with half clips, and the grip on these shoes seems to be the same as that of the Five Tens. I haven't ridden them on a long ride (>25 miles) yet, so can't say how they'll feel after more than a few hours. But so far, I'm pleased.
review.name: Great shoes

hasVariant.name: Insta-Gater Pro Truck Tailgate Mount
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Insta-Gater Pro Truck Tailgate Mount online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Needed something to use in my Ridgeline to carry my MTB. The Ridgeline bed is about a foot to short with the tailgate closed and I did not want to take a wheel off so I made a bracket to hold the ratchet straps and pop riveted the bracket to the tailgate, With the gate down and the bed extender rails in place the bike is secure and the anti theft strap keeps it safe and sound. The Insta gator is very well made and makes a great bike stand when in the garage and for washing the bike. If you have a standard bed truck it mounts in a minute or so.
review.name: MODIFIED

review.reviewBody: I like the way it holds my bike in the truck bed, but featured locking cable doesn’t extend long enough to lock bike.
review.name: Locking Feature Failure

review.reviewBody: I have been using the insta gater pro for several weeks. I like the ingenuity of it. Simple but effective,  the stability of this is pretty good when tailgates closed. Easy to adjust and overall, I'm very happy with it.
review.name: Easy to use and great unit.

review.reviewBody: I have a mountain bike. The tires are at 29x2.8, so the tires are slightly fat. They don’t fit well within the tire holder. Even with the tire pressed against the tailgate the bike wobbles in turns and along bumps. I don’t think the bike will will fall, but it stresses me out watching it wobble. I think it’s good for the short ride to the local trail but, having a hard time convincing myself to do it on longer drives. I wish the holder would be longer/higher with an extra strap higher up to provide more security. It probably also doesn’t help I have a shorter truck bed and am having to put in the rear tire and having front tire turned, as it’s easier for the bike to sway. Great concept I want to trust it but it hard to.
review.name: Great concept but slightly unsturdy

review.reviewBody: I have an Insta-Gator that I purchased about 4-5 years ago that still works fine. I can mount my bike in seconds. The newer model that I just purchased is a major redesign. I can’t swing the locking arm between the front tire and frame without forcing the rubberized hook as it rubs the frame and tire. It’s probably going to rub the paint off. I bought this newer model to carry my granddaughter’s bike so I hope it works. My bike is a Trek Domane with composite frame and 32mm tires. Will probably work okay with my other Domane with 25mm tires. I’d return it had I known. Too late now. I’ll most likely shave the rubber a little on the top of the hook to make it thinner. The rivets on the original are prone to rust and it looks like this newer model has similar fasteners.
review.name: Updated design a step backwards
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule Insta-Gater Pro. 
I understand your frustration with the fit issues you experienced between your bike and the rack. It sounds like the issue results from the spacing between the lower frame of the bike and the wider 32mm tires. 
I am sorry this bike rack did not meet your needs. The Thule Insta-Gater Pro is designed to fit securely to the widest variety of bikes and wheel combinations.

review.reviewBody: It's a smart design but in practice it never feels like the bike is truly stable.  In terms of security (e.g., theft prevention) any idiot could crack this; I also use a cable lock but even that gives me so-so confidence.  That said, this rack is up to Thule standards ("we're your least bad option"), and kudos to them for designing a mtn/road bike rack speshly for us rednecks ;-)
review.name: Secure-ish Rack

review.reviewBody: Installed the Insta Water Pro on my truck bed and it works fantastic. The security and stability of the clamp is very stable. The bike are easily able to be moved in and out of truck with no issue. My Thule bike rack makes things a lot easier to transport mountain bikes. I highly recommend this purchase.
review.name: Superior Bike Rack

review.reviewBody: User friendly and very well built.  I would suggest this product for anyone who doesn't want hitch style system.  Thank you for another good product.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: The installation is simple but, it requires that the tire is against the tailgate to be most stable. When you tighten the rack against the tailgate with a 29" or 27.5" tire it pulls the rack forward so the tire is not seated entirely in the tire track, reducing stability. Because the track support is so narrow, the bike is secure but not stable. What I mean by that is, once the bike is secured in the rack it is not going to fall over but, it does move from side to side a great deal when going over speed bumps or on rough roads. I purchased three of these for my truck (the most you can fit in a full size bed) and because you can install the bikes forward or backwards, they shouldn't hit each other when rocking back and forth. If they had a way to connect multiple Insta-gaters together it would help a great deal with the stability issue. I settled on the insta-gater because I needed a solution where the bikes are in the bed of the truck and out of the way when I am towing our camper. As well something that is easy to install and remove while not taking up a lot of room when not in use. I had the Apex 4 bike rack for many years and the bikes would frequently get loose in the rack and fall into each other. When my carbon fiber road bike got damaged beyond repair in that rack I decided it was time to finally get rid of it. The insta-gater is a much better solution than that rack. There is a way to lock the rack to your bed by looping your own lock through the rack and attaching it to your truck bed but, if you have multiple racks, you would need multiple cables. Overall, this is a very good solution for truck bed racks BUT you should be aware that your bikes are going to wobble side to side a great deal when on rough roads.
review.name: Best solution for full size truck but not perfect

review.reviewBody: Very high quality.. Heavy gauge metal and good coating..good design although the release mechanism is close to the derailleur on my two bikes, if it was higher up the arm it wouldn't hit anything. Other than that it's a great product
review.name: Great Product

name: Insta-Gater Pro Truck Tailgate Mount

review.itemreviewed: Alpha Flight RoS Limited Edition Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I just received this today and immediately tried it on and headed outside...to feed our horses and do farrier work on several. Is a breeze from NW and about 35 degrees. This is ample and able to keep me very comfortable without anything else over top. I will wear this doing our barrel race competitions all winter, indoor arenas, but still need to be outside most of the time doing prep. And of course, this will be used riding my Trek through the winter months also. So is a dual purpose cold weather jacket, and I am confident that it will keep me very comfortable and often will include another jacket overtop doing either of my activities. Sometimes only a windbreaker and sometimes more. I like the vest type double front, which allows another level of ventilation.
review.name: Really good wx protection

review.itemreviewed: Alpha Flight RoS Limited Edition Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent insulation and wind-blocking material. Its streamline fit feels light and very non-restrictive. With bayer layer and long sleeve shirt, I was comfortable in mid to upper 40's. I'm 5-9" and 140 lbs. with athletic build and XL firs nicely.
review.name: Great colder weather jacket

name: Alpha Flight RoS Limited Edition Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: What's better than fantastic? My size 14 are perfect, not labeled wide but fit very nice. Warm but not to warm comfort like a down pillow and the ability to go from inside to outside absolutely brilliant.

review.reviewBody: This rules. It looks silly. It feels silly. Very comfy. Very fun. Wear it almost every day.
review.name: Spaceman boots

review.reviewBody: These Booties are toasty warm in very cold conditions and comfy. I would suggest that the loop in the back be sewn up the back heel cover and loop at the top. This will make life easier for some of us older less flexible folks.
review.name: I sure would purchase these booties again.

review.reviewBody: There is no heel support. Wearing these while standing up working at my stand-up desk in my home office was uncomfortable. After wearing these in 55 degree house temperature for 30 minutes, my feet and these shoes were still cold
review.name: There is no heel support + not warm

review.reviewBody: These are easy to slip on and off. My feet stay dry and warm in snowy, slushy, and wet conditions. I'm happy with my purchase
review.name: Great warm and water resistant slip ons

review.reviewBody: Need something warm to take the dogs out in winter
review.name: Comfy

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my hubby and myself (women's version) and we know have them in several colors. We live in them. Over the last few years we've worn them on ski trips, camping, walking our dogs, outside when it's cold, around the house, even hiking!! They have never shown a single sign of ruin or tear etc. The traction is unbelievable! We hardly wear any other shoes except when at work or dressing up lol! Even our first pairs are still going strong. They are so darn comfortable! Buy them. Buy 5 pairs of them! They are some of the best multi use shoes we've ever owned!
review.name: Literally live in them

review.reviewBody: Love these slippers - lightweight and warm. My toes are always the first thing to get cold - these warm me up and are super comfortable! Kicking myself I didn't get them years ago.
review.name: Comfortable - Warm - Lightweight

review.reviewBody: Warm and comfortable. Quick to throw on for outside chores in the mornings.
review.name: This is his second pair.

review.reviewBody: These will be Christmas presents for the kids. Haven't opened them yet but they appear to be fantastic and mine are comfy
review.name: Great Christmas gift

review.reviewBody: I am a very small person and these pants fit the bill for a ski pant that doesn’t seem overly baggy for my stature. The padded beacon pocket is also very nice alternative to wearing the beacon on the harness. These are my new favorite touring pant.
review.name: Slim Fit

review.reviewBody:
These pants are great because they are lightweight, have all the right pockets, fit well, have good venting. In addition, they don't contain PFAS which I love because I like to leave no trace and avoid exposure to toxic forever-chemicals. 

Have used these for several years on around 200 days of mostly backcountry skiing and they are perfect 95% of the time (on super cold and deep days I sometimes opt for bib pants but those days are rare!). They are also very durable unless you're careless with boot crampons.
review.name: Go-to ski touring, snowshoing and resort skiing pants for Sierra Nevada

review.reviewBody: I have worn these pants nearly everyday for the past 2 seasons and ordered another pair after a few tears and holes in places. Highly recommended, plenty water/wind resistant.
review.name: Great Softshell Pants

review.reviewBody: These pants are incredible for touring. My old pants were incredibly heavy and cumbersome. The Dawn Patrol Hybrid pants are perfect - lightweight and high mobility while keeping me warm and dry. The pockets are especially innovative.
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody:
Why are there not two hip pockets, seems like a silly choice based on fashion. I'm constantly trying to put things in a left hip pocket because that's what I'm used to. Every other pair of pants has a left pocket. If I put bulky things in the right pocket they sit under the transceiver pocket, and if that is being used it's uncomfortable. If I put something like a cell phone in the left thigh pocket it flaps around too much. Whether I'm guiding or forecasting I need enough pockets for all the things, transceiver, phone, pit book, ect.. and these pants don't work well for my system. 
Second I'm 6'4 with a 36" waist, I need a XL for length but need to cinch down the waist. However, the provided webbing belt is thin, the buckle slips and the waist is low rise so my lower back is always exposed, again, seems like a fashion over function design choice, why not make the waist higher at the back and provide belt loops so I can use a decent belt that is wide enough. 
They move well when touring, and I like that they are not rando racer skinny, but they have some idiosyncracies and I'll be looking for other pants that work better for me.
review.name: Lack of two hip pockets and low rise waist are annoying

review.reviewBody: Slightly warmer soft shell that fits so comfortably! Great for at the resort or in the backcountry. I have mainly used it for days I want to ski tour to get where I want to go ice climb and they have worked great
review.name: Best pant

review.reviewBody: Great pants for touring. It’s been hard for me to find soft shell pants that aren’t over insulated/ thick and fit like a ski pant should. These do! Plus waterproofing in all the areas they should be… Butt and Lowe legs, breathable soft shell everywhere else. Took them out yesterday for a tour and it was 10* at the car and 15* on the summit. Didn’t get too warm or cold with the bd 150g merino wool long John’s.
review.name: Great pants for touring. It’s

review.reviewBody: 5'10", 170 pounds. Fit is perfect. The stretch and unrestricted movement of the non hybrid Dawn Patrol made it a given to get the Hybrid for powder days.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: As a small female, I LOVE these pants for guiding. They cinch small enough at the waist to fit, but are baggy which gives me optimum space for full movement, and big pockets. A shame I need to get men's medium to have these features, but I'll take it! surprisingly incredibly waterproof for being "softshell" esque in texture. Fav pants I have.
review.name: LOVE

review.reviewBody:
Seem like great pants. I got them for an upcoming touring trip. What I like so far are:
-Lightweight but seem durable
-Stretchy
- Very Comfortable
- The extra padding in the beacon pocket.
review.name: Great So far.

name: Dawn Patrol Hybrid Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody:
These are amazing! We love them. ❤️ My dad got my husband and I both a set for Christmas like 10 years ago or more. They are still in perfect condition. We use them for hunting, playing in the snow or anytime we have to be outside for long periods of time in the cold. When I go hunting and it's super cold or wind chill of -15. I wear mine, my husband's and my under armour sweat pants under my hunting bibs. No need for a heater at all. My son told me he needed some bigger under layers so I automatically ordered him this set. He is going to be so excited when he gets the Christmas morning. If you have multiple children you definitely need to get these. They are such a good quality and will last for years if they are taken care of. 
The adults sizes are pretty unisex in the bottoms. The woman's top seems to be a little more fitted for the breast.
review.name: Fantastic quality and so warm

review.reviewBody: By far the best and warmest product you can buy. The sizing accurate. Spend the money and buy this instead of the cheaper, knock offs that do not perform as well.
review.name: Best there is

review.reviewBody: These are great! They keep me warm in the coldest weather. I’m always cold so these are a blessing for me because they keep me warm and they are not bulky. They wash up great.
review.name: Keeps you warm

name: Packaged Base 4.0 Legging - Boys'

review.reviewBody: Bought this right before my 1500 mile bike tour down the west coast. It was so perfect for that tour & is still perfect for casual commutes -- completely waterproof in rainstorms, really easily accessible while riding, the perfect size to store a lot of items without getting too bulky (my husband calls it Mary Poppins purse because it's always shocking how much you can pack into it!) -- I usually store a longsleeved baselayer + extra water bottle + snacks + wallet + bikelock. I highly recommend!
review.name: Love it!!

review.reviewBody:
I got this after my first bikepacking trip, where I realized I needed a way to get to things quickly and easily without stopping and taking off my camelbak to get things.
I haven't bikepacked with this yet but It seems like it will fit the bill. I got the smallest one they make because it's only going to carry my phone, chapstik, maybe a rain shell, snacks. It's plenty big enough for all that, plus it has a clear window on top for a map or phone that you can see while riding. It opens with a magnet closer toward you when riding, and that seems very well thought out. It also locks.
It was easy to install, I have a carbon fiber handlebar and it attaches with a cord that you pull tight. They say not to put it on carbon fiber but I just wrapped some waterproof electric tape on the bars where the  cord goes, and honestly, I can't see where there will be any trouble at all. This is a mountain bike so these handlebars have seen some rough treatment and been just fine.
I'm looking forward to trying it out on a  trip, but I'm fairly confident it'll be just what I needed.
review.name: just what I think I need

review.reviewBody: While I haven't actually mounted the bag, I took it out of the box, attached the mounting bracket to the bag, and positioned it approximately where it should be for regular use. Based on that exercise, I'm fairly confident that my hands wouldn't be able to rest comfortably on the hoods without rubbing against the bag. I'd imagine this would quickly become annoying, so unfortunately the bag is going back. It's a shame, it seems well-designed and durable like the rest of Ortlieb's products.
review.name: Doesn't fit Nitto Randonneur 42cm bars

name: Ultimate 6 Classic Handlebar Bag

review.reviewBody:
I bought this to supplement  my ~2011 Osprey Atmos which is still going strong. I needed a bigger bag to haul gear for children who are almost old enough for their first overnight trip. I went with this model because I wanted the daylite lid daypack. I followed the sizing guide and fit instructions on Osprey?s site and got a great fit.

This thing is considerably heavier than my Atmos but also has a higher carry weight range which is something I needed. I love the zipper access to the main compartment and the sleeping bag compartment. All of the features on my old Atmos are here, so if you?re familiar with Osprey packs, all of the attachments points, pockets, and compression straps should be similar. 

The fit is MUCH more comfortable than my old Atmos, but the back panel is slightly warmer than the suspended mesh panel of the Atmos. I have only carried it weighted around the house. I?ll update after used backpacking.
review.name: On the heavier side but tons of features

review.reviewBody: Been searching for a rain jacket that wasn't athletic cut/fit. I question if I got a mislabeled item - the shoulder seams are 3" past my shoulders. It's all-over too large.
review.name: Beautiful jacket but I swim in it

review.reviewBody: I always wanted my own Patagonia jacket.  I love my husband's torrent shell and another windbreaker piece he has.  However, they are huge on me, nonetheless I borrow them for dog walks and rainy coastal days sometimes.  I had gotten Patagonia fleece and vest before but I found their styles for women tend to be narrow at the hips.  So I considered getting something and just sizing up.  The time came when I actually needed a rain jacket, (when I am not borrowing my husbands I had a cute 3/4 rain trench by Uniqlo that began peeling in the lining after a few years). I saw this oversized one and was delighted!  At the time that I looked, there were few reviews online for this jacket.  And the reviews were a tad conflicting.  Some saying way too oversized, some saying true to size: 50/50.  I chickened out on the oversized and got the small (I am usually somewhere between a small and medium in most things), but small didn't work.  The size small body is oversized and good.  I'd say slightly oversized body.  Enough to fit layers underneath for sure, but the hood and sleeves were DEFINITELY a small.  The hood made me feel like a pee head.  The sleeves stopped right before the heel of my hand and any raising of the arms exposed my wrists.  For rainy weather I want more hood and more arm/some hand coverage.  So I returned and got the medium and its a true to oversized fit.  The body is oversized but not obscenely huge.  The sleeves cover the heel of my hands, the hood is comfortable. I am 5'6. 145 lbs, 32DD, with an athletic, build.  I highly recommend this jacket.  Rainy season is over, but I did get to wear it out once so far, and I got instant compliments.  It's a classic.  I look forward to many rainy seasons with it.  I kind wish I had gotten the Sienna color.  But I wasn't sure the tone would be right for me.  I got the green.
review.name: I feel complete

name: Outdoor Everyday Rain Jacket - Women's

hasVariant.name: Entrata Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Entrata Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought these Castelli shorts on sale. Reviewers warned that they ran small. I’m a medium and bought a large. I think I could have bought an extra large!  Just a great short overall- elastic cuffs on the legs are the best I’ve had on. Padding is comfortable and well stitched.  Get them. But definitely get a size or two bigger.
review.name: Great shorts- runs very small!

review.reviewBody: Not a bad buy for $50. I have several bib shorts from Castelli, all quite well-made and fit me well, support muscles, etc. My beef with 90% of the mens cycling shorts out there is that the waistband on the shorts rise nearly to my navel, and that's uncomfortable for me - I favor shorts, pants, etc. to ride lower, on my hips. On many other brands I own, I have to fold the waistband over an inch or so (doubled-up) or it becomes uncomfortable to me over time. I suspected from online photos & such that these Entrata shorts ride a bit lower on the waist, and that turned out to be true. I'm 6'0" and 156 LBS., slender, and size M fits me snugly in all other Castelli stuff, bibs, jerseys. So, definitely more comfortable in the waist for me. Standard Castelli chamois; I usually wear "cycling underwear" with an additional pad for extra comfort on long rides, no matter what type of brand of bibs or shorts I'm wearing otherwise. Also note that, as with most Castelli items, they may seem to run a bit small, as compared to identical sizing for street clothing, but then I prefer snug and aero when on the bike, so size M does just fine for me. As with all other Castelli items I've bought, well-made & well-designed, high quality construction. My go-to favorite cycling kit.
review.name: Decent Value For A Castelli Garment

review.reviewBody: MY second pair of Estrada....  Comfortable with good chamois, runs SMALL!
review.name: Castelli Entrada shorts

review.reviewBody:
The pad on these shorts were roughly cut and just sewn in.  So there is an edge all around the pad.  This seems so shoddily made compared to every other short I've seen or own (Rapha, REI, Pearl Izumi, Zoic).  I still tried them on to see how they fit and it fit well but was too worried I'd get irritated by how much of the excess pad was flapping out beyond the stitch or it'd fold up weird and cause irritation.

After looking at other shorts they make it looks like this is just what Castelli does which is just weird but at least was partially covered by the stitch in.  

The size was right going by their measurements to size.  People seem to freak out about Castelli sizes.  They should just use numbers or something so people don't freak out about being a XXL when normally they wear an L or XL.  It's just a lot more range of sizes.
review.name: Possibly defective?

review.reviewBody: I love these shorts. Very premium feel and a great chamois. I'm 6.3 and 210 lbs and the XXL fits me perfect. Keeps me comfy on the longest rides. Just ordered another pair.
review.name: Great Shorts!!!!

review.reviewBody: Was expecting a fit with a Large that would be comfortable. Wearable, but very tight. I normally wear a Medium in US cycling shorts such as Giro and Hincapie. Knowing that Castelli  runs small, I went up a size. Should have gone to an XL. I have a 33inch waist!
review.name: Runs Small

review.reviewBody: I was wondering if these were youth... I'm usually a M or L (6'1", 165 lbs) and the Large was way too tight.  I returned for an XL and hoped those would fit better.  I have a 32" waist and even the XL way wayyyy too tight.  Had to return both sizes, and pay return shipping unfortunately.  I think I'll stick with PEARL iZUMi shorts, they seem more true to size.
review.name: runs ridiculously small

name: Entrata Short - Men's

hasVariant.name: Rocket Steel Saddle
hasVariant.description: Buy the WTB Rocket Steel Saddle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I?ve tried so many saddles in an attempt to find something that works, and the Rocket is perfect for me. The first saddle I?ve ridden that doesn?t hurt after 2+hrs. With most other saddles I tended to be way up towards the nose and I?d get saddle sores. But since this is a bit narrower, I sit further back where I should be. Saddles are very personal, so be aware that this might not be the one for you. I used the WTB saddle finder on their website and it recommended this one, so I recommend doing that before you buy. For reference, I?m 5?10?, 130-135lbs, ~30? hip circumference. This price can?t be beat for this saddle, too.
review.name: Narrower is better! (For me, anyway)

review.reviewBody:
Best Bang for your Buck!! Rocket (Wide) knocks it out of the park! Comfort, durability, and style for under $40.00!! 

Team Shred!
review.name: Rocket All Night Long...

review.reviewBody: Lobes are soft leading to good grip but reduced durability, but all around they're hard to beat
review.name: Industry standard

review.reviewBody: These offsets are well built and are solid in flares and pods. Recently many have opted for totems instead, but two good lobes and two bad lobes aren't a substitute for four good lobes in a flare. Placing the z4 feels excellent, the trigger feels smooth and precise even when pumped.
review.name: Excellent, not a specialty piece

review.reviewBody: LOVE these for Yosemite, but great everywhere. flaring placements are a slam dunk with the off sets. I tell people to buy an offset before they buy a second of any size, because you can be inventive and make them work more places than either the size above or below them.
review.name: brilliant!

review.reviewBody: Your microcam collection really isn't complete unless you include offsets. With the small expansion range offsets can be bomber where straight cams catch only 2 or 3 lobes
review.name: Solid pro

review.reviewBody: Bought my first set of Z4 Offsets after using C4/X4’s for years and I’m so impressed. The tiny changes like stem , textured/narrower lobes and new style trigger wire guard is really nice. Kind of thinking I need a whole set of Z4 micro cams as well now.
review.name: Can they get any better?!

review.reviewBody: The thin lobes and offset sizing always places really well in flares, eyebrows, and pods. I always carry a rack these days with the 3 smallest on one oval. In the alpine these are my go to double rack addition. The low profile slings are and added bonus for lightness
review.name: Perfect in almost all situations

review.reviewBody: Love the size and versatility of the Z4’s. Easy to place and fit into all types of small cracks.
review.name: Great Cams

review.reviewBody: Fits perfectly into small cracks that don’t allow for nuts.
review.name: Fits perfectly into small cracks

review.reviewBody: Does exactly what it needs to in flared cracks and flakes.
review.name: Ideal!

review.reviewBody: I had the X4 cams and compared to them, these work way better when re-locating them in the crag!
review.name: Amazing desing

review.reviewBody: I now own two Lightweight Fleece Hoodies because they are incredibly soft, warm, and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: This will be my new go-to sweatshirt. It is the most comfortable piece of clothing I have ever worn! I ended up purchasing two colors. Very nice fit for me with the small- it is light and loose but not baggy.

review.reviewBody: Or I need to get another for when this one is in the wash pile. Super soft and cozy. I run hot, so this is the perfect weight. I was bummed that the medium in fatigue color was sold out. I ordered the small and hoped for the best. Turns out small is the right size for my 5'3" and 120 lb body. review.reviewBody: Love the hoodie, it seems to run a bit large, but so comfortable, again great for the fall time being outdoors as the weather is turning cooler.

review.reviewBody:
These looked much whiter on my screen, but the Pearl color in person is a pink-toned off-white. In bright light it looks bone-colored, but in dimmer light it looks subtly pink. I like this color as it doesn't feel like a marching band boot. If you wear a lot of neutrals, this boot will go with a lot of your clothing. 

This is my first pair of Blundstones, and they fit true to size. This style is a bit narrow at the shaft and took about a week's daily wear to loosen the elastic enough to get them off easily. There was no break-in period, though, and on first wear I walked over 5 miles in them in total comfort.

I thought they would scuff or mark easily, but I've put around 50 miles of city walking in them in both sun and rain and they are still pristine. I haven't treated them with a leather conditioner, but I will soon.
 
If you're on the fence about this color, I say go for it. I was about to get black, but decided to go with the Pearl and have no regrets.
review.name: Comfort and beauty!

review.reviewBody: I have never been more disappointed in a purchase. All I have ever heard is how great Blundstones are. They are not great. These claim to be water resistant but they're not, water comes right through the leather. They have to be treated to repel water which will change the color. Also they are not comfortable, you'll need a sole insert. I will never buy another pair of blundstones. I will never recommend them to anyone.
review.name: Overhyped

review.reviewBody: I love these boots! These are my second pair only because I wanted another version in a different color. Breaking in these boots can be daunting, They're strong and made of great material. Plan to wear med thickness socks that come over the top of the boot, or else you will have some tender areas on the inside of the ankle, heel, and around the edge. Definately worth it, I'm still giving these 5 stars because of the comfort, as well as work hard, then wear with a dress for a day out on the town. Great product!
review.name: Great boot!

review.reviewBody:
First time ordering from backcountry too, and I'm impressed! My order came in a day earlier than I was expecting. Love these boots! 

I was worried about the "breaking in" period as I've never had a nice pair of leather boots before.  I only struggled with getting them on and off the first few times wearing and now it's a breeze. The sole is so comfortable too and I never had an issue with it. One day I walked all over downtown with them on and that's the only time my heel was a little sensitive, but there were no blisters (note, I wear thick socks with these, otherwise it would've hurt more).  I'm a size 9.5/10 and I went with the size 7 for these. Perfect fit! Not too small or clunky.
review.name: first pair of blunnies!

review.reviewBody: Love these boots! Super comfy and great for winter. Runs a bit small. I normally wear a 7.5 in boots but went up to a size 8 for these.
review.name: Great Boots!

review.reviewBody: Got these boots for my girlfriend for her birthday. She loves her blundstones and wears these just about everyday since she got them! great quality.
review.name: Great Gift!

name: High Top Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: It’s so comfy and cozy. I got a small and it’s plenty big to wear layers under. I’ve gotten compliments every time I wear it!!
review.name: Ultra Cozy Fleece Shacket

review.reviewBody:
This was a nice heavier jacket, but I was sad the inner lining was smooth/satiny rather than the same fuzzy faux fur/shearling so it didn't feel as cozy as I'd hoped. 

I'm 5'5, 160lbs and this also hit too high on the hip, making me look wider than I actually am so I had to return. 

With a 38D chest this was also a smidge too tight, an XL might have worked but wasn't available.
review.name: too short, lined differently

review.reviewBody:
Runs a little big. I’m a size 8-10. Originally ordered a S. I like a little closer fit and exchanged for an XS. It’s a perfect fit!
The exchange process was a breeze!
Quality is A+.
review.name: Runs a little big. I’m

review.reviewBody: It’s a nice jacket, but not flattering on me. Made me look bulky, so I returned it.
review.name: Too boxy for me

review.reviewBody: This jacket is everything you want! Super soft and cozy. Perfect for those early mornings when there’s a crisp chill in the air.
review.name: Soft and cozy

review.reviewBody: Fits true to size, so soft, looks great, and is warm. I love this shacket! It will definitely become a fall and winter staple.
review.name: Perfect Shacket

review.reviewBody: Absolutely sumptuous. So soft! The seems in the jacket and the cool buttons give it that extra bit of specialness. Exceeded my expectations. Extremely flattering and oh so comfy. It is also fully lined. Exquisite. Will love this jacket forever. Couldn’t decide between the chocolate and the ivory so purchased both. Both are gorgeous.
review.name: My favorite winter garment

review.reviewBody: Loveeeee this shacket! Desperately waiting for the weather to cool off so I can wear it constantly!
review.name: New fave!

name: Rider Shacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have two pair of these now. I have a small waist compared to thigh ratio. I'm 5'3" waist 27" and chose a size small. These pants are high-waisted and cinch down to adjust the waist, so the fit is perfection. I love the cargo pockets and the soft fabric. Everything about these pants is A+
review.name: Beautiful color and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit for girls with curves. It’s so hard to find pants designed for small waists and wide hips/butt and athletic thighs. These fit so well that I bought two more pairs in other colors!
review.name: So good I bought two more pairs

review.reviewBody: I always get so many compliments when wearing the teal ones, I also got their burnt sienna colour too! Wore them multipitching in Red Rock and sat comfortably underneath my harness. Pockets were handy for snacks too!
review.name: Multi-pitched in them!

review.reviewBody: BEST OUTDOOR PANTS!! These pants are the best! They fit perfectly and look good all day long! Very comfortable as well. I am 5'3" sz. small tall was perfect. Waist is also adjustable
review.name: An outdoorsy girl must have!

review.reviewBody: I LOVE these pants. They are very flattering and they are super functional as they have so many pockets. The waist is also super adjustable so you can cinch it as much as you want. I can't wait to order another pair. They fit TTS and hold up well in the wash.
review.name: Flattering AND functional!

review.reviewBody: These pants are great! So happy to own a pair of hiking pants that are so stylish and functional. The adjustable straps are my favorite feature. These do not disappoint!

You need these! I love how comfortable and stretchy these are! I took these on my trip to Sedona ( I did multiple hikes) and I am impressed that they still look new! I love how they make my waist look as well.  Definitely recommend!
review.name: need need need!

name: Isabel 3.0 Outdoor Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I got this for running.  It's fine, but it's not great. I don't love the appearance, but that's just personal preference. I'd rate it higher but my Oiselle visor absorbs sweat better.  I do sweat a lot.  I wore this for all my marathon training. I like that you can adjust it; I have a smaller head and often can't get visors with velcro bands to adjust small enough to fit my head.
This is my second trail visor since I liked my first
review.name: Perfect for paddling

review.reviewBody: I really like this visor. It's got good sun protection, is very light, comfy, can machine wash it, good for walking or hiking. Can't go wrong with this one.
review.name: Nice Light Visor

review.reviewBody: My third one... in a different color. Love the shape.
review.name: Great visor

review.reviewBody: Price reduced one day after purchase but customer service wouldn't match and wasted an hour over a dozen emails.
review.name: Scammy

review.reviewBody: Really pretty blue, super lightweight easy to adjust!
review.name: Much lighter weight that I expected

review.reviewBody: I bought this looking for something for hot summer hikes. I also wear it around town because it looks so great. On a day where my young daughter forgot her own hat, I realized this visor fit her great as well - something not usually possible with a normal hat
review.name: Great hat young to old

review.reviewBody: I wore the visor for about a week and I was loving it. I like the strap system in the back because it doesn't get stuck in hair easily. Unfortunately the back part of the strap broke off and now it won't stay tight on my head. I'm not surprised it broke because it is a tiny piece of plastic but I am disappointed.
review.name: Comfortable visor, strap broke

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This visor is certainly a visor. If you want to block the sun without wearing a hat you could hardly do better.
review.name: Certainly a Visor

review.reviewBody: light weight, nice sweat band, and good clip in back for easy on/off (or attaching to something while not wearing).
review.name: great visor
