review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect size to fit in small space. Straw is nice and durable.
review.name: Great Tumbler

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love my hydro flasks. We use them at home at work and when we’re camping. Exiting to know I can now recycle the ones that have been damaged instead of throwing them away.
review.name: Can’t live without our hydro flasks

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They are great. Work well keeps your drink cold for hours.
review.name: They are great. Work well

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve been using the Tumbler for a few months now, and I’m really impressed!

The insulation is fantastic. It keeps my drinks cold for hours, even in the heat of Pakistan! I’ve tested it multiple times, and it’s performed incredibly well, keeping my ice water cold throughout the day. 

At first, the size felt a bit broader to hold, especially if you’re used to smaller tumblers, but my hands quickly got used to it. Now, it feels comfortable, and the slight extra width is worth it for the capacity it offers.

The design is solid and durable, with no exterior sweating. The lid seals tightly, so I haven’t had to worry about spills, and the built-in straw is a super convenient feature for drinking on the go.
review.name: Why This Tumbler is a Must-Have for Everyone?

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought one in gray and one in agave and they have become our favorite cups to drink out of around the house because they hold so much more, have the lids and straws, and keep our drinks cold longer especially down here in Texas.
review.name: Tumbler

review.reviewBody: The cup its self is cute. I use it for my iced coffee and it keeps it cold but the straw, oh my goodness!, the straw is terrible. I don’t care that it’s silicone but it makes this whistling sound EVERY TIME I sip out of it! Horrible! For the price paid there should not be an issue to use the straw nor it sound like I’m whistling when I use it. I force myself to use it because of the amount I paid for the cup but I don’t use it at work or in public because it makes that whistling sound when I drink out of it. Then when I add the lid to my cup whatever liquid I have in the cup comes out the straw from the top. I make sure I don’t overfill to prevent this from happening but it does not help.
review.name: It’s ok

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fantastic. This thing follows me everywhere, going from desk to kitchen, to SUV console, to bedside table. A breeze to clean… just make sure the airhole at the base of the straw matches up with the divet in the top so there is air flow. :)
review.name: Exactly what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Like it a lot, easy to clean, keeps my drink ready cold almost all day, made a great buy.
review.name: Great tumbler

review.reviewBody: Figured we could try the tumbler since we love the water bottles so much for their quality, colors, shape/size. This is no different! We have the indigo color and it's a beautiful deep blue. I have terribly weak hand strength and can easily take the lid off and disassemble the straw, which is refreshing after so many terrible designs with twist-on lids. The flexible straw is the best. I just wish the straw inside was metal instead of plastic.
review.name: Fantastic tumbler

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for smoothies and iced matcha lattes or any beverage!!!
review.name: So Happy

name: 28oz All Around Tumbler Straw Lid

review.reviewBody: I am an athletic trainer at Northland College in Ashland, WI.  I use your product as a very reliable medical equipment for when my teams are on the road to visit other schools 4 - 6 hours away.  Your bags are very durable for the use that they take.  I use them as crutch bags for my medical equipment.  Some of the big Sportsmedicine companies will charge $200 - $300 for a padded crutch bag and fall apart within 6 months.  Plus your product looks so nice and makes my teams while traveling, very professional looking.  They get compliments all the time.  My coaches like the size to be able to put additional sporting equipment in them for storage other than crutches and knee immobilizers.  Thank you for carrying this product in your line up.
review.name: Tough product, handles the abuse

name: Snow Bag

hasVariant.description: Buy the Haglofs L.I.M Fuse Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I own the women's pants and couldn't be happier. I don't like to climb in leggings or shorts and in Utah the summers are hot as heck so these pants are the perfect match for me. The material is super lightweight and breathable but still offers the protection of a pant. The fit is really clean and I appreciate the generous zip pocket on the thigh. Ideal for hiking and climbing but comfy to work from home in as well.
review.name: Perfect Summer Pant

review.reviewBody:
These absolutely RULE. A couple pairs of these and you're absolutely set for anything you could imagine. The material is comfortable and feels natural - which is an awesome change-of-pace from many technical/trekking pants on the market. They're stretchy and soft, and they fit really well.

The thing I love about these is they're great to wear on questionable weather days when you're hitting the trail or the crag, but they're just as good wearing around town. They really are a catch all. They're breathable as promised and the DWR waterproofing does an excellent job.
review.name: The only pants you need!

description: Buy the Lezyne Road Caddy Saddle Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Road Caddy Saddle Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Lezyne Road Caddy Saddle Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: For me this is a perfect but minimal size bag.  For road I carry a regular 700c tube, three CO2, an inflator, multi-tool, tire lever, tire boot and no glue patch kit.  For gravel tubeless setup, a fat 700c tube, two CO2, tubeless repair kit, inflator, multi-tool, tire lever and tire boot.  Yes, it takes some careful packing and is hard to zip fitting all that stuff, but it all fits and keeps a low profile on the bike.  The multi-tool, inflator, and tubeless repair kit are all of course of the mini sized variety...
review.name: Perfect size

review.reviewBody: I crammed a single 700 tube in here and I can't fit anything else. There's nothing useful about this bag.
review.name: Way too small

review.reviewBody: The bag finds the sweet spot between too small and just right. I wanted something low profile, but big enough to fit long-ride essentials. With some brut force and advanced Tetris skills, I managed to fit my multi-tool, one CO2 cartridge, a tube repair kit, and a spare tube. The bag neatly tucks beneath the saddle and does not distract from my bikes clean aesthetics. Consequently, I am happy with the purchase and would recommend it to anyone looking for a minimalist bag.
review.name: The Sizing Sweet Spot

review.reviewBody: The picture is not accurate for the XL. I figured it would be a little bit bigger, but it's a lot bigger and does not fit neatly under the saddle, instead projecting a couple of inches out. Seems to be well constructed and would be great if you want to bring a tube, tools, inflater, CO2, keys, and some snacks.
review.name: Wrong Picture for the XL

review.reviewBody:
I love this bag, it's easy to install and take-off the bike, and is extremely secure, you don't feel it while riding at all and I think it looks really good. It does soak up water, but keeps contents relatively dry for not being waterproof/resistant at all. This bag is small, I have tire levers, a spare tubolito tube, multi-tool, and some other odds and ends in it and it's maxed out. I carry my pump by my bottle cage, and light on my seatpost.
Everything you might need for most rides, and nothing you don't.
I would recommend this if you're looking for something smaller/sleeker.
review.name: Great Minimalist/Weight Weenie bag

review.reviewBody: I wanted a low profile seat bag, but it is so low profile it is almost unusable for me. Takes an act of god to get a road tire, levers and tool and zipped up.  A little time consuming to put on and take off as well. Not a fan.
review.name: A little too small

name: Road Caddy Saddle Bag

description: Buy the Exped Megamat Duo 10 Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Megamat Duo 10 Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Exped Megamat Duo 10 Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I did a bunch of research or sleeping pads and was hesitant to drop this much money. But if you can afford it and have the space it is so comfy.
review.name: Lives up to the hype.

review.reviewBody: This is the best purchase we've made for car camping. Bought after a friend let us crash on theirs. They use it as an air mattress when they have guests staying in their basement and we had the best sleep ever so decided to spring for it. The first time we used it, it kept us so warm on unexpectedly 40 degree night. No ragrets. Just get it.
review.name: Best Mattress Ever

review.reviewBody: This thing is awesome! Super easy to deploy and to pack away and man it's comfortable.
review.name: Super Comfortable, Super Easy

review.reviewBody: I love the comfort of this foam air pad better than my bed. I always look forward to camping because I get the best sleep!! It’s SO comfortable!
review.name: Better than my bed’s mattress

review.reviewBody: I bought this mattress based on the glowing reviews. I wanted something for car camping trips that would be comfortable enough for my partner and I to share, and this seemed like the ticket even though it was pricey. It's mostly lived up to my expectations — it's definitely super comfortable! I used it on two weekend camping trips, and then on only the third use it wouldn't hold air overnight. This was massively disappointing as I'm careful with my gear. It was stored as the manufacturer recommended and I was careful to brush off any dirt or sand before rolling it up at camp. I've used a few other types of inflatable sleeping pads over the years and have never encountered a leak. On the plus side, their customer service was excellent. I had to pay for shipping to Tacoma for repairs (which was about $80, so not by any means cheap), but they repaired and shipped it back for free within a few weeks. The shipment included a slip indicating that my mattress had three leaks, one on the top and two on the sidewall, and I'm still not really sure how they happened. Really hoping it doesn't develop any more leaks, as I will be asking for a refund or replacement if it happens again with such little use.
review.name: Cautiously Optimistic

review.reviewBody:
I have use it for 3 years and i love it 
Everything about it is perfect!!!
I have camp for 3 months streigh in cold weather, rain, etc. So i know what i'm talking about
review.name: Best camping gadget

review.reviewBody: If you are trying to woo city slicker by taking her out camping, this is the pad to use.  Fits perfectly in the REI half dome 2+.  Comfortable.  Roomy.  A little bit of a process to inflate and deflate, but...eh...it is what it is.  Highly recommend.  5/5 stars.
review.name: Great for sleepovers

review.reviewBody: I bought this to use in our roof top tent and it is just a game changer.  Hands down best sleep I?ve ever gotten while camping using this pad.  The inflate and deflate process is quick and easy, rolls up easily and super comfortable.  Highly recommended!
review.name: Wow

review.reviewBody: No need to lose sleep crammed on a small camping pad worried about ending up on the ground. The Megamat will get you stoked to get out there although you may not want to get out of bed..
review.name: It'll change your life!!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this for car/boat camping and as a spare mattress for guests.  After the initial break in it inflates on its own in no time.  This is one of the most comfortable self inflating mattresses I have used.  Deflation and pack up is easy and despite its inflated size, it packs up fairly small and doesn?t weigh very much.  I?m very pleased with this purchase.
review.name: Extremely comfortable

name: Megamat Duo 10 Sleeping Pad
Megamat Duo 10 Sleeping Pad

review.reviewBody:
Overall it seems like a decent build.  It doesn't fit me.  My hat size is 7 3/8 and medium was too small.  Large fits over my oval head but it's loose on the sides.  I comes with extra cheek pads but they weren't much different in size.  When I adjust for how it sits on my head so that the from brim of the helmet lined up with my brow, the chin strap was pressing into my neck.   The strap is non-adjustable. Only other small gripe is that tightening the back side dial is easy but untightening it is awkward.  removing the chin bar is not easy but can be done while wearing.  What's nice is you can loosen and raise it up to drink from a bottle and the lower down. If you take bar off you'll have to take helmet off to get back on.  This may break in over time.

If it fit I would have kept it.  I gave three stars because of the non adjustable strap cutting into neck.
review.name: Chin strap cuts into neck

review.reviewBody: I live in Arizona where it is blisteringly hot, and even I cant justify the removable chin bar. It barely affects the airflow, and just makes the helmet less protective and more expensive. As a full-face helmet it preforms alright. It is defiantly a step up from my cheap moto helmets. I will say it fits remarkably well with Giro goggles.
review.name: I don't see the point

review.reviewBody: Stepping up from a lighter full face after a crash, this helmet has an excellent fit and the odorless pads are a nice feature.
review.name: Burlier Brain Bucket

review.reviewBody: This is a sweet helmet. People complain about putting on and taking off the chin guard but they are just whining. It's not hard to put it on if you have any coordination whatsoever. But it fits my head really well, and I forget that it's on my head when riding. About 30 minutes ago it saw its first real OTB and I hit my head pretty good in the gravelly dirt. Not a scratch on me or the lid. I got it on sale. Its nice with the chin guard off too. I don't use it as much halfsy as I do full face. Because it's a full face helmet. But being able to take the chin guard off when it gets hot or when riding gets calmer is way convenient. That's why I bought it.  Buy it if you want 2 good helmets in one.
review.name: Dope

name: Switchblade Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great value. Best jacket for cold mornings and warm afternoons out in the field.
review.name: Great for cold mornings and warm afternoons

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great hunting jacket for small game and rifle hunting.  Heavy duty material for briars and warmth.  Plenty of space for gear.
review.name: Excellent jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The item was as described and shipped promptly. I have an earlier model and its great and feel this one will be great as well.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: I love this coat for hunting. It’s comfortable, warm and carries a heavy load of birds, water, dog stuff, etc very well.
review.name: Great coat

review.reviewBody: You want tough?  This is it!   I bought mine almost 30 years ago and have quail hunted in a lot of brush and sand plum thickets every year since.  The material resisted every thorn that I ran into!  The first failure happened recently when the vest zipper got caught in the dryer and broke the metal pull.  I am sad because I have worn that fleece vest at least a thousand times in addition to those many hunts. I see now that there are even several improvements over mine, but I don’t need a new one!!  If you want one last, best jacket/vest, this is the one!!
review.name: Best money can buy!!

review.reviewBody: Purchased two years ago.... no failures... very tough.  Only improvement you could make to this jacket is to have a dual zipper so you could unzip from bottom of jacket. Excellent purchase and a good, solid piece of hunting equipment.
review.name: 2nd year.... standing by my original rating

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a amazing product. It is warm and blocks the wind excellently. The placement of the bird pocket and all other pockets are in all the right places.
review.name: Excellent upland coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I followed the recommendations that this jacket runs big in size.... maybe back in 2015 when most of the reviews were describing this.....but not now. I am 6'3" @ 220lbs with an athletic build, bought the med. size as recommended and i couldn't zip the jacket closed (that's how small it was)....no issue with the product, its a medium. Buy your size ! Returning for a LARGE. Like construction and materials of product (as expected)
review.name: this jacket runs true to size

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is the second best companion (after bird dog) when out during bird season. The flexible vest/jacket/liner are just right for variable fall conditions. Plenty of pocket space. Great value.
review.name: Must have for bird season

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the pockets. Like the water bottle slots. Haven’t time tested it yet since it just arrived but seems to be well made and have all the features listed.
review.name: Nice hunting jacket

name: Ptarmigan Interchange Parka - Men's

description: Buy the SOREL Hi-Line Hiker Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hi-Line Hiker Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the SOREL Hi-Line Hiker Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Wore these for a few hikes over the last few months. Super cute, wicked comfortable, and 100% no traction. 
Wiped out on them scrambling over a boulder and they couldn’t handle a few icy trail bits this past weekend. I was pumped to rock these guys on the tail but they’re not worth taking out a knee. Gotta retire these from future hiking ventures.
review.name: They’ve got the looks

review.reviewBody: So comfortable, True to size, casual boot. Just got these and am super happy with them. I haven't tested them with rainy/wet conditions yet, but I did a couple layers of weatherproof spray in preparation.
review.name: So comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Great Shoe, fits like it should! Fits like other Sorels purchased!
review.name: Great fit/Exactly as described!

review.reviewBody: Exactly as pictured. Not super feminine but still cute with my jeans or hiking pants. They are comfy and very light. I did order a half size up and I think it was a good idea. My foot is a little wider but that didn't seem to be an issue. I'd recommend. 🙂
review.name: I like my boots.

review.reviewBody: Muy bonitos y confortables.buen color .buen mix. Se lucw la marca.calidad.
review.name: Confortables

review.reviewBody: Absolutely in love with these boots, they look cool feel very comfy, and lightweight. After few months of wearing them they still look like they’re new. Ordered them in all available colours.
review.name: Got them in all the colours

review.reviewBody:
Hi!
Although I don’t usually spend this much on most foot wear, Sorel isn’t most Footwear!
I trusted Sorel because of past knowledge of their Quality, Durability, & Style.
I just moved up North so these were the Only Move!
review.name: Finding Right Pair & Right Shoe Place

review.reviewBody: Beautiful original and stylish look and very comfortable! Slightly concerned about the sole not being a bit harder, as it might wear off quickly, so I am a bit anxious about this. Still, a great buy!
review.name: Lovely

review.reviewBody: Absolutely in love with these boots!! Wear them to work everyday standing 8 hours and haven’t hurt my feet at all!!

I like these alot, good height for wearning with ckinny jeans rolled up, they are comfy for dog walks (good cushioning) - I am a "wider" foot, but dont require a wide - so was worried they would be too narrow - they are fine.
Only downside is the laces continuously loosen and then the ankles are loose (also think there could/shoul have been better placement of the lace hooks - so room for one more at top).  Hence I have to double tie these and I HATE double ties - looks messy and a pain to untie when in a rush coming inside with dog... Just saying, wish the hooks and laces were designed to keep the ankles better secure.  I will probably swap out the laces - but I like the orangish color.
Regardless I love to wear them because they are cute and comfy.  I have the Tawny buff color.
review.name: Like alot - but ...

name: Hi-Line Hiker Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable short with nice leg grippers and a soft waistline.  Great buy at the price point. Definitely recommended.
review.name: Supremely comfortable

review.reviewBody:
I've been riding this year about 3-4 times a week for an hour to 2 hours per ride.   I recently wore out an old pair of shorts and looked for a replacement pair.  I still use Specialized shorts but I was still feeling discomfort from sitting on my bike for that amount of time.

I looked all over online for new shorts that had enough padding to let me cycle for up to 2 hours without pain in my rear.    Of all the brands and shorts I looked at, a common theme emerged - 'not as comfortable as my Pearl Izumis'.   So I bit the bullet and ordered the Interval shorts.   Their padding is adequate.   But my two criticisms are that the padding is a mesh rather than a solid/homogeneous chamois, so after a while riding, it starts to chafe.   In addition, the spandex material used for these shorts doesn't breathe the way my Specialized shorts do, which makes criticism #1 even worse as I get sweaty and sticky on the rides, independent of the weather.
review.name: Start to chafe after about 30 minutes

review.reviewBody: I bought these to replace my Pearl izumi elite in-R-cool shorts. These shorts are a little longer but I didn't have any problems with that.
review.name: Great Shorts

review.reviewBody: I think the best you can say about any shorts or bibs is that you don't notice them when you're in the saddle. I didn't notice these at all. Fit is the same as the castelli at the same price point.
review.name: Great Shorts

review.reviewBody: Sizing seems smaller than prior versions of same product.  This design has a prominent seam across the back and it feels like the shorts are falling down.  Disappointed
review.name: Bad design changes

name: Interval Short - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Joy Peak II Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this coat in green over a month ago and loved it at first. I only buy columbia coats because they are so warm and this one is the same. Unfortunately this coat in green stains so easily. It shows every mark. I spilled a couple drops of milk on it and it immediately turn into a dark spot. I hadn't washed it twice and the marks do not come out! Do not buy the green color. Such a bummer for the cost.
review.name: Stains easily

review.itemreviewed: Joy Peak II Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was back and forth between medium and large (5'9, 140-150 lbs). The fit guide was helpful and recommended medium but I went with large so it would be looser and I wouldn't feel constricted with layers under it, and it's great. The jacket is lightweight but very warm. The pockets are soft and very deep.
review.name: Great for being active outdoors

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great mountain biking pack! Not too big but just enough room for water, bike tools, a tube and a few snacks.
review.name: Great mountain biking pack! Not

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Works as advertised to include comfort & surprised how much can fit inside.
review.name: Works as advertised to include

review.reviewBody: Fits like a glove, holds the essentials, has room on the strap to attach a small camera case, does not get particularly hot, thanks to air flow construction. Used on a bike tour of Cambodia (85-95 degrees F) and on day rides in New York (40-50 degrees F). Never used it as a hydration pack. Removed the bladder immediately. Instead carried sunglasses, large smartphone, snacks, small tube of sunscreen, passport, cash, electrolyte drink mix packets, bike multitool.
review.name: Excellent warm weather biking bag

review.reviewBody: This pack is great for short excursions. While it is a biking pack, I use mine for short hikes and snowshoeing. It has been awesome to use while recovering from a shoulder injury. It has enough room for water, snacks, and small essentials. I moved the mouthpiece closer to the belt buckle because it would disconnect from the magnet constantly when you move your arms. Also, a mesh pocket in the front would be great to quickly stash and access a cell phone. My biggest disappointment with this pack is the lack of a reservoir cleaning kit. It is very inconvenient to clean the small reservoir and dry it out. I end up using multiple reusable straws to poke into the reservoir to keep it open and allow air flow and get it dry. Would love to see a proper drying rack.
review.name: Great Pack!

name: Seral 4L Hydration Pack

review.reviewBody:
By far the best grip of any flats I've tried, sometimes it's almost too grippy... if I get my foot skeewah when dropping in, it can be sketchy because it's hard to actually shift your foot to the right position, but you get used to this, and once you figure it out, the locked-on feel is amazing and is a super confidence boost when taking big airs.
I only use these for a dedicated park bike, so not sure how they actually pedal, but I can't imagine they'd be a problem. Time will tell how the durability holds up.
review.name: The best

review.reviewBody: I don't now if it's the 2.5 mm of concavity or the pin placement, but the first thing you notice on these pedals is the excellent grip.  Of course the downside of that is repositioning your feet.  But just like any other pedal, you quickly get used to it and it's not a problem.   Another benefit is that there is no bulbous inboard bearing like is common on other pedals.   That means you can put your foot in close to the cranks, if you choose to.   As you might expect from the pin placement, you can really push down on the outboard side of these pedals without loosing grip.
review.name: Functionality as good as the looks

review.reviewBody: I have had two pair of T-MACs and have put several thousand miles on each pair. I loved these pedals, which remain grippier than any others I have ridden, which include Deity Blade Runners, Specialized Boomslangs, One Up Aluminums and Wolftooth Waveforms.  My T-Macs required complete service annually.  This is easy to do unless the bushings also need to be replaced. The bushings can be removed with a tap, but their split ring design makes them difficult to install without a specific installation drift (using a socked failed as it distorted the bushing). I ended up shipping the pedals to the factory for bushing installation.  Not a deal killer, but inconvenient if you do not have a good set of backup pedals.  While super grippy and confidence-inspiring, there were a couple of downsides to the design:  (1) they are relatively thick, which noticeably increased pedal strikes on the trails I ride, and (2) these pedal strikes on ricks ripped out pins which could not be replaced because their sockets were too badly distorted.   In the end, I lost enough pins that I needed to get new pedals.  I have not had the same problem with the Waveform pins, which screw in from the backside and therefore have a more robust interface with pedal body.
review.name: Fantastic performance but pin issues

review.reviewBody:
wide enough to comfortably place your foot and the concave shape helps to keep your feet in place.

I was using the PNW composite pedal before this and found this pedal an upgrade in terms of the grip and foot placement.

Have yet to break a pin but only time will tell, also this pedal comes with extra pins if your pins does break
review.name: Robust and the grip is crazy!

name: TMAC Pedals

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these! So warm and perfect for round the house. If there is anything I would like on them it would be a draw cord so I can tighten them abit.
review.name: I absolutely love these! So

review.reviewBody: They don’t stay on my feet as well as the more robust version (previously had the shell, lined boots). I trip going up stairs in them. But they are warm and comfy.
review.name: They don’t stay on my

review.reviewBody:
I have very small feet for a man. From Rab’s size chart I ordered a small. This was way too big so I sent for an xs which now does grip to my leg and feels attached but there’s about an inch of extra boot from where my toes stop. I haven’t been in any mountain huts since purchasing them but they are great to have if you want toasty feet but look at slippers and worry that the greyness and the fabric and the sole design age you about 30years.
Once you’ve got your family to stop calling them slippers just to annoy you the only problem is fit.
review.name: I have very small feet

review.reviewBody: I chose a medium as I am a size 7. They feel a little 'floppy' on but are comfortable and warm to wear. Wouldn't recommend if intend to walk around in them but good for an extra layer of warmth if not mobile.
review.name: I chose a medium as

review.reviewBody: Lovely and soft without the overheating. Yes they’re loose but I don’t think they’re anything they’re not claiming to be. They’re not great outdoors on wet ground - waterproof base is good but obviously it doesn’t come up round the edges. Great as house slippers and would do grand for bothy or in tent (I like the flexibility of the sole so they could be kept on in sleeping bag).
review.name: Love these boots

review.reviewBody: i got the medium and im a size 8 but there way to big, i should have got the small gutted
review.name: to big

review.reviewBody: Although very warm they were a poor fit and did not give any structure to the foot. I wish I had read the website reviews first as I would have gathered this information before ordering
review.name: Although very warm they were

review.reviewBody: I really don’t like to leave bad reviews but felt I had to with these. They are weird, ill fitting, cheap looking and incredibly uncomfortable. The elastic that turns them from a simple thin fleece tube with a flimsy sole, into something slightly resembling a boot, constantly digs into your ankles, and they are intent on sliding off as you walk. Wondering if mine were too small I tried on the larger pair I bought for my partner (who is not liking his either) and had the same experience. Sadly so busy/ill over Christmas I’ve missed the window for returns. An expensive mistake.
review.name: I really don’t like to

review.reviewBody: Size range is to large if you are a size at the low end of the fitting then the boot flops about at the toe end and is not good for walking in.
review.name: Size range is to large

review.reviewBody: Generally ok warmth-wise but the fit is too baggy around the ankle/lower leg and the design is such that your foot naturally sits too far back with your heel hanging over the edge of the sole and they flop around too much. I remedied this by taking-in the loose material down the back of the slipper on the sewing machine to make them a snuggger fit round the ankle, which also pushes the foot further forward and into a better position on the sole. Would have preferred if they'd fit well first time.
review.name: Generally ok warmth-wise but the

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these to have for when it is cold and to keep me warm when camping during winter. I did a lot of research before I purchased these. They are pricey, but worth it. First of all they are thicker and the fit is perfect. They are also flattering and not so thin which allows me to wear them as normal winter leggings as well. Also as pjs around the house during winter too. I loved them so much I decided to buy two more pairs and the base layer tops to match. If you are able to afford these and want thermal base layers that last then these I highly recommend. I’m 5’6, weigh 133 lbs, 30 inch lower waist and a medium fits me perfect.
review.name: Super warm thermal leggings!

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: They are high waisted and true to fit. I'm a curvy woman and they fit very comfortably. I wore these under my jeans in Japan in January. They kept me warm and they are oder repellent which is nice while traveling. Highly recommend.
review.name: True to size

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: I usually struggle to find the perfect fit in bottom base layers, but I was pleasantly surprised to find these fit like a glove right out of the box. I have a bigger bum and run into the issue of layers either being too snug at the waist or too loose at the thighs, but I did not run into this issue at all with these. I wear them casually after a day on the slopes as well and can absolutely see myself wearing them camping, hiking, and in just about any outdoor scenario where the temps drop!
review.name: In love!

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: The fabric is nice. Unfortunately these are low rise and definitely made for someone with a flat butt. Nice and long though which is what I like. Couldn't keep them though due to that low rise.
review.name: Low rise

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased new merino wool layer for a river trip in February. I loved them. Just an added layer to my fleece layer but they were Perfect. Can wait until they are the only layer under my drysuit.
review.name: New layers!

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love my Smartwool Classic Thermal Merino base layers! They are soft, super warm (especially given their thickness), retain their shape, and don't get stinky, even after multiple wears between washes. I wear them downhill skiing, touring, and under my street clothes at night. I normally wear an XS, but I sized up in both the bottom and top.
review.name: My favorite baselayer!

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: I really wanted to like these! They're a great color, they fit under my other pants nicely, and they are super soft. However, it added zero warmth to what I was wearing. It actually held in cold more than it kept me warm. Also, it really attracts and holds onto pet hair.
review.name: They're soft, but don't hold in heat

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this. I get extra 15% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Brilliant!

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: Got a large per the size chart but found the waist band to be several inches too big. Returned for a size medium, following backcountry’s instructions for exchanges but have not received a refund for my first pair.
review.name: Runs Large

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Women's
review.reviewBody: runs small, weirdly tight on my calves. itchy. too short. attracts EVERYTHING so they easily become covered in hair lint etc. don’t like the rise (wish it was higher). they do a decent job of keeping me warm but they’re so uncomfortable i don’t like wearing them. wish it was easier to make a return.
review.name: don’t waste your $$$$

name: Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Women's
